trial_identification.studytitle: Multiple-Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of BMS-779788 in Healthy Subjects
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Placebo-Controlled, Ascending, Multiple-Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of BMS-779788 in Healthy Subjects

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - BMS-779788 Treatment: drugs - BMS-779788 Treatment: drugs - BMS-779788 Treatment: drugs - Placebo
Active Comparator: BMS-779788 or Placebo (Arm 1) -
Active Comparator: BMS-779788 or Placebo (Arm 2) -
Active Comparator: BMS-779788 or Placebo (Arm 3) -
Treatment: drugs: BMS-779788 Oral Solution, Oral, 1 mg, Once daily, 7 days
Treatment: drugs: BMS-779788 Oral Solution, Oral, 2 mg, Once daily, 7 days
Treatment: drugs: BMS-779788 Oral Solution, Oral, <= 4 mg, Once daily, 7 days
Treatment: drugs: Placebo Oral Solution, Oral, 0 mg, Once daily, 7 days

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety assessment, including medical review of adverse event reports and the results of vital sign measurements, ECGs, physical examinations, and clinical laboratory tests
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 8 times within 27 days of the first dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Pharmacokinetics (Target gene expression of BMS-779788 in whole blood and adipose tissue and corresponding serum markers)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Men and women (not of child bearing potential) ages 18 to 45
- Healthy subjects as determined by no clinically significant deviation from normal in medical history, physical examination, ECGs, and clinical laboratory determinations
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Women of child bearing potential
- Evidence of organ dysfunction or any clinically significant deviation from normal in physical examination, vital signs, ECG or clinical laboratory determinations

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of multiple oral doses of BMS-779788 in healthy subjects
